column5: The Management, Finance and Accounting - MSc course at the University of Leicester provides students with a thorough understanding of the role of accounting and finance in organisational management. The core modules focus on developing an understanding of theories, models, frameworks, and techniques of management while the specialist modules allow you to focus on areas relating to your professional needs with regards to financial management and accounting. This combination prepares students for careers in public or private sector organisations or academic research in this area by providing them with essential skills such as analytical ability, independent research abilities, time management skills, communication skills (both written and verbal), presentation skills, etc. This is a test edit.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time
